com.adobe.cq.address.api

Interface AddressProvider

  • Deprecated. 
    As of AEM 6.4

    @Deprecated
public interface AddressProvider

    • Method Summary

      Adds an address to the user.
      Address getAddress(ResourceResolver resolver, java.lang.String userID, java.lang.String path)
      Deprecated. 
      Returns the address based on a path if represented in the repository or based on an ID uniquely identifying the address in an external provider.

      Deprecated.

    • Method Detail

      • getAddresses

        java.util.Collection<Address> getAddresses(ResourceResolver resolver,
                                           java.lang.String userID)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the addresses belonging to a user.
        Parameters:
        resolver - The resource resolver used to access the address book
        userID - The user ID
        Returns:
        The addresses or null if there are none

      • getAddress

        Address getAddress(ResourceResolver resolver,
                   java.lang.String userID,
                   java.lang.String path)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the address based on a path if represented in the repository or based on an ID uniquely identifying the address in an external provider.
        Parameters:
        resolver - The resource resolver used to access the address book
        userID - The user ID
        path - The path identifying the address or an ID uniquely identifying the address in an external provider
        Returns:
        The address or null if it does not exist or if it does not belong to the user

      • removeAddress

        void removeAddress(ResourceResolver resolver,
                   java.lang.String userID,
                   Address address,
                   boolean autoSave)
            throws AddressException
        Deprecated. 
        Removes the address.
        Parameters:
        resolver - The resource resolver used to access the address book
        userID - The user ID
        address - The address
        autoSave - If true the operation is persisted
        Throws:
        AddressException - when the address does not belong to the user or when the operation fails.

      • addAddress

        Address addAddress(ResourceResolver resolver,
                   java.lang.String userID,
                   java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties,
                   boolean autoSave)
            throws AddressException
        Deprecated. 
        Adds an address to the user.
        Parameters:
        resolver - The resource resolver used to access the address book
        userID - The user ID
        properties - The address properties
        autoSave - If true the operation is persisted
        Returns:
        The new address
        Throws:
        AddressException - when the operation fails.

      • updateAddress

        Address updateAddress(ResourceResolver resolver,
                      java.lang.String userID,
                      Address address,
                      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> properties,
                      boolean autoSave)
               throws AddressException
        Deprecated. 
        Updates the address.
        Parameters:
        resolver - The resource resolver used to access the address book
        userID - The user ID
        address - The address
        properties - The address properties
        autoSave - If true the operation is persisted
        Returns:
        The updated address
        Throws:
        AddressException - when the address does not belong to the user or when the operation fails.

      • getDefaultAddress

        Address getDefaultAddress(ResourceResolver resolver,
                          java.lang.String userID)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the generic default address of the user.
        Parameters:
        resolver - The resource resolver used to access the address book
        userID - The user ID
        Returns:
        the generic default address of the user

      • getDefaultAddress

        Address getDefaultAddress(ResourceResolver resolver,
                          java.lang.String userID,
                          java.lang.String type)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns the default address that is defined for the given type (e.g.: billing, shipping.).
        Parameters:
        resolver - The resource resolver used to access the address book
        userID - The user ID
        type - The type of the default address. E.g.: billing, shipping. If the type is null or empty, the generic default address is returned.
        Returns:
        the generic default address of the user

      • setDefaultAddress

        void setDefaultAddress(ResourceResolver resolver,
                       java.lang.String userID,
                       Address address,
                       boolean autoSave)
                throws AddressException
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the generic default address of the user.
        Parameters:
        resolver - The resource resolver used to access the address book
        userID - The user ID
        address - The address
        autoSave - If true the operation is persisted
        Throws:
        AddressException - when the address does not belong to the user or when the operation fails.

      • setDefaultAddress

        void setDefaultAddress(ResourceResolver resolver,
                       java.lang.String userID,
                       Address address,
                       java.lang.String type,
                       boolean autoSave)
                throws AddressException
        Deprecated. 
        Sets the default address for the given type (e.g.: billing, shipping.).
        Parameters:
        resolver - The resource resolver used to access the address book
        userID - The user ID
        address - The address
        type - The type of the default address. E.g.: billing, shipping. If the given type is null or empty, the generic default address is set.
        autoSave - If true the operation is persisted
        Throws:
        AddressException - when the address does not belong to the user or when the operation fails.
